author: sky.cactus
content: I recommend checking out the discussion in EIPIP meeting #90 to give you some insight into the conversation around requirements for being an editor.  The general consensus from those in the meeting was that the set of EIP Editors should include people who are "active editors", not "anyone who has every been an active editor".  There was then a brief discussion on what some vague requirements are for being considered an "active editor" like showing up to EIPIP meetings from time to time, reviewing EIPs on a semi-regular basis, engaging with editorial process tasks, etc.

author: gcolvin
content:
I had already discussed my intentions with Pooja, <@301186049323958275>  It would have been appropriate for someone  to discuss this with me personally _before_ reducing my status.

I've put years of my life into this, and am the longest serving active editor.   I _have not consented_ to any change to my active status.

What I want is for the tools to inform myself and authors that I am available to review EIPs, and to able to merge them into the repo when I do.  That is all, thank you.
